The correct answer is A: It represents the objectâ€™s tangential velocity, drawn tangentially because velocity aligns with the direction of motion as the speaker describes.

In the audio, the narrator explains that the arrow labeled "V" is tangential to the circle and represents the tangential velocity of the object moving in circular motion. The tangential velocity is the component of velocity that is perpendicular to the radius vector and is responsible for the change in position along the circumference of the circle. The tangential velocity is always directed along the tangent at any point on the circle's circumference, which is why the arrow is drawn tangentially.
